observation.output:
Testing separability matrix issue reproduction...
Issue description:
1. Simple compound model: m.Linear1D(10) & m.Linear1D(5) works correctly
2. Extended compound: m.Pix2Sky_TAN() & m.Linear1D(10) & m.Linear1D(5) works correctly
3. Nested compound: m.Pix2Sky_TAN() & cm (where cm is the first compound) fails

Expected behavior: Nested compound should have same separability as extended compound
Actual behavior: Nested compound shows false dependencies

Analyzing separable.py structure...
Key functions found in separable.py:
- separability_matrix(): Main function
- _separable(): Core algorithm
- _cstack(): Handles '&' operator
- _cdot(): Handles '|' operator
- _coord_matrix(): Creates coordinate matrices for simple models

The issue likely lies in how _separable() handles nested CompoundModels...
When a CompoundModel contains another CompoundModel, the recursion may not
properly preserve the separability structure.
